meanings.sent1: I grab my toy when I see it on the floor.
meanings.sent2: She likes to grab her favorite book from the shelf.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to grab the laser pointer but missed.
meanings.sent4: Time seems to grab hold of us when we're having fun.
meanings.sent5: The wind can grab your hat and carry it away in an instant.

meanings.definition: A sudden or quick grasp or snatch
meanings.sent1: His grab for the last cookie was unsuccessful.
meanings.sent2: The child's grab for the balloon was swift and determined.
meanings.sent3: The monkey's grab for the banana was comical to watch.
meanings.sent4: Her grab for attention in class was met with eye rolls.
meanings.sent5: The eagle's grab of the fish from the water was a sight to behold.
